Introduction

Lee Ga-eun (sometimes romanised as Lee Ka-eun) is a South Korean actress and singer under High Entertainment. She is known as a former competitor of Produce 48 and a former member of AFTER SCHOOL. Lee is currently working solely as an actress and has featured in several dramas.

It was reported in April 2012 that Gaeun made her first appearance with AFTER SCHOOL at Zepp Tokyo, during the performances of "Let's Do It" and the Japanese version of "BANG!" marking her admission. Lee officially made her debut as a member in the group's fifth single release, Flashback.

In July 2019, Gaeun made her solo debut with the digital single "Remember You" to convey gratitude for her fans, marking her departure from Pledis Entertainment.
